comment._content: the "ballyhoo artist" is the fellow in the Charlie Chaplin outift balancing his cane on his hat, presumably to attract customers to the Chaplin movies being shown there that day. A commentator on a forum devoted to Coney Island has described the film on the banners, including the release dates, all from March or April, 1915. www.coneyisland.com/cgi-bin/yabb/YaBB.pl?num=1247857344 Another notes that the ticket guy at the far right of the picture is selling tickets to Feucht's Drop-the-Dip roller coaster on the south side of the Bowery at about 15th.
